text: Describe how you can decide which operation(s) to use to solve a problem.

• Multiplication can be used to find percentages of numbers or to find a total number when you perform an operation multiple times.
  • Division can be used to find rates and the size of individual parts.
  • Addition and subtraction can be used when you are combining multiple integers to find a total.
  • Regrouping integers based on the Distributive Property will not change the final answer. Itâ€™s just another way to write expressions.
